refactor.description: Changes that restructure or improve code without changing behavior.

feat.description: Changes that introduce a new feature.

build.description:
Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies.
Example scopes: gulp, broccoli, npm.

chore.description: Changes that do not affect production code or user-facing behavior.

style.description: Changes that do not affect code logic, such as whitespace, formatting, or missing semicolons.

test.description: Changes that add missing tests or fix existing ones.

ci.description:
Changes that affect CI configuration files and scripts.
Example scopes: actions, jenkins, tekton, circleci.

revert.description: Changes that revert a previous commit, typically referencing the reverted commit hash.

Closes.description: The commit closes issues or pull requests.

Co-authored-by.description: The specified person co-authored the commit's changes.

Signed-off-by.description: Certifies the committer has the rights to submit the work under the project's license or agrees to a contributor representation such as a Developer Certificate of Origin.

Reviewed-by.description: The specified person reviewed and is satisfied with the commit's changes.

Tested-by.description: The specified person tested the commit's changes and confirmed the desired behavior.

Acked-by.description: The specified person acknowledged or approved the commit's changes.

Refs.description:
The commit references another commit by its hash ID.
For multiple hash IDs, use a comma as a separator.
